The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post. Do you like to use or would like to use strategies to win? If you do, then get ready to stretch your mind to outwit your opponents. The Indian Game Theory Society, in collaboration with Equipoise - The economics club of IIM Ahmedabad present to you “Stratazenith – strategize to reach the zenith”! Stratazenith is a strategy based event modelled on game theory. Event details: Games will have problem statements based on simple real-life situations each having multiple rounds. After each round, the participants will be informed about their scores using which they can observe the behaviour of their opponents and strategize accordingly to maximise their scores. You don’t need to have any prior knowledge to participate in the event. Team size: 2 You only need to carry a pen. Prizes worth INR 4,000 to be won! Venue: CR7, New Campus, IIM Ahmedabad Date: 25th February, Sunday Time: 2:00 to 4:30pm
story: The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post.

message:
Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success - Swami Sivananda
Get ready to thrill your brain with games giving you adrenalin rush through the event.
The KGPian Game Theory Society (Chapter of The Indian Game Theory Society) in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents to you Battle Of Brains, An on spot strategy based event.
Date : 21st/ January/ 2k18
Venue: Vikramshila
Timings: 9am- 6pm
Do register at https://goo.gl/forms/xIP7XyhYAhP8wVkV2

message:
Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason   why so few engage in it. So, you think, you think? Come, find out this Sunday at 9 am, in F-127(the so called MAGGU ROOM). 

Look around, you are not the only one. Kindly do register at tinyurl.com/warofwits5 before coming. Psych yourself up, for this is not going to be easy.

Team KGTS heartily congratulates our alumnus Mr Prabhat Agarwal for being awarded the Silver Medal for the best academic performance among the graduating 4 year BTech CSE students in 2017.We wish him the best for all his future endeavors and hope that he continues to inspire us with his zeal for excellence.
story: The KGPian Game Theory Society is with Partha P Chakrabarti and Prabhat Agarwal.

The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's photo. Today ,the IGTS team wishes our Founder President and Mentor Manoj Gadia a very Happy Birthday ! Under his guidance the last academic session has been quite a journey with IGTS organizing its events and spreading game theory across many campuses in India. Our DTU and IIM Rohtak chapters established in the last session also complete 1 year today. Here's hoping we continue to set new milestones in the upcoming session under his leadership. :)
story: The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's photo.
